text: Muskogean (also Muskhogean) is a language family spoken in the Southeastern United States. Members of the family are Indigenous Languages of the Americas. One documented language, Apalachee, is no longer spoken, and the remaining languages are critically endangered.Broadwell, George Aaron. (1992). Reconstructing Proto-Muskogean Language and Prehistory: Preliminary Results (PDF). Paper presented at the Southern Anthropological Society, St. Augustine, FL. Retrieved on 2009-05-03. ==References== ==Other websites== *Muskogean Language Family page at native-languages.org *Chickasaw Language Information & Videos - Chickasaw.TV Category:Languages of the United States
title: Muskogean languages
